comment.body:
I'm not very tech-deep in how ZN stuff works, but... Assuming, that we have a Plugins at our disposal... Can the plugin solve this issue on a content-downloading stage?

What I mean is:
1) Assume someone created a new zite, signed&published it for everyone and now is the only seeder of his own website.
2) Assume that this person used `jquery-3.1.0.min.js` lib as his JS assets.
3) Each file has SHA512 checksum.
4) New person now enters the newly created website of a person above. Files are being transferred.
5) During this file-transfer, we can use the plugin. This plugin will perform a check in visitor's `data` folder:
5.1) On exact filename match. If found, cast check shasum on it.
5.2) If not found on exact filematch, run shahash search on `content.json` files and stop on first match.
6) Procedure by plugin runs only once. If similar file with matching shasum is found, plugin will create a symlink to the local file from another data folder.

The problem is with the symlink: plugin will need to handle absolute path in owner's zite somehow, without modifying the sources. So, if owner's zite had this included in his <head> section:
```
<script src="js/jquery-3.1.0.min.js"></script>
```
the plugin's task will be to intercept this resource loading and instead load it from symlink. I.e., this library was found in folder `/1A83ijw3boqTtqdLz8me7AqeK1nEK8yxeu/jquery-3.1.0.min.js` (Kaffie.bit website, visited by client earlier). Then plugin will load this library and prevent original link from being loaded.

Or it can be somehow (if it is possible) stored as a key:value in users.json file or any other file, that can be safely modified by plugins (or create something like `localcdn.db` to get things from there). It is all hazy and unclean, since I don't know a lot of details, but it should be enough to get the idea... :)
